Name: Maria del Carmen Vazquez Alvarado
Explain Crime/Violence: There was a man in the shelter she was staying in who acted as though he was a fellow migrant but whom she suspects was a coyote. This man offered to cross her and her son, but when she didn't immediately agree he threatened her, saying that if she and her son didn't come with the group of migrants he was going to try to cross, something bad could happen to her son. This man also told Maria that he wanted to speak with her husband about the cost of crossing her and her son, so she gave him her husband's phone number. However, when this man called her husband, it was to extort him. He told the husband that he had Maria and their child and asked for ransom money, even though he had not, in fact, kidnapped Maria or her son. Maria's husband was alarmed at the extortion attempts and threatss so he advised Maria to leave the shelter and go to another state in Mexico. She fled to Puebla and was a result missed a hearing and therefore she has an in absentia removal order from January 2020.
Notes: Former MPP but no longer has an active MPP case because she has an in absentia removal order from January, 2020. She missed the hearing because she had fled Juarez after she was threatened by a coyote. There was a man in the shelter she was staying in who acted as though he was a fellow migrant but whom she suspects was a coyote. This man offered to cross her and her son, but when she didn't immediately agree he threatened her, saying that if she and her son didn't come with the group of migrants he was going to try to cross, something bad could happen to her son. This man also told Maria that he wanted to speak with her husband about the cost of crossing her and her son, so she gave him her husband's phone number. However, when this man called her husband, it was to extort him and to threaten kill Maria and her son. He lied to the husband, telling him that he was holding Maria and her son hostage and asked for ransom money (he had not, in fact, kidnapped Maria or her son). Maria's husband was alarmed at the extortion attempts and threats so he advised Maria to leave the shelter and go to another state in Mexico. She fled to Puebla and as a result missed a hearing before the immigration court. She has an in absentia removal order from January 2020. Asylum seeker, she was being extorted in Guatemala and was severely beaten shortly before she fled.

Name: Emilsa Xiomara Alvarado Jacobo
Notes:
She exited Guatemala 17 years ago when she was 18 years of age. She has two USC children. She stated she EWI'd in 2005 or 2006 she is not sure what year. She stated she had previously entered and was deported back but then tried again and was successful. She stated she lived in the U.S 12 years.  Voluntary departure she went to Mexico 04/10/2014.  She stated her husband was very ill due to an accident because he suffered a heart attack  since he needed a heart transplant but due to the length of time they had to wait the transplant never happened and he died on April 27,2018 and was in Michoacán Mexico at the time. She stated that on the birth certificate for her children she put herself as a single mother since her husband had been deported. 

She has not to cross the border as of yet. She is in Shelter Aposento alto.

Britzy Yarel Gomen Alvardo DOB: 11/05/2013 (7yrs old) Minneapolis Minesota

No tiene registro ni espacio asignado en albergues. Huyo de su pais por la situacion politica y economica, falta d empleo y seguridad y subsistencia social. A uno de sus sobrinos el Gobierno de oposicion (oficialismo) de Nicolas Maduro, lo acusan de Terrorismo y lo tienen detenido injustificadamente; lo sacaron de su casa a la fuerza, violando sus derechos. Por esa razon y el temor de las fuerzas armadas y amenazas, busca el asilo politico en EU para apoyar a su familia para un mejor modo de vida en el extranjero. Su patrocinador en EU es un Amigo de la familia, quien vive en California.

Name: Isela Navarrete Canseco

Ha pedido ayuda a Coespo y a HIAS, los cuales no le han dado respuesta y actualmente el cartel ya los localizo a ella y a sus hijos nuevamente en esta ciudad, donde a su hijo mayor de 18 años, hace 3 dias lo balearon en la calle 16 de Septiembre, el corrio y se escondio en un hotel. Se comunico posteriormente con ella para avisarle lo sucedido y ya no sabe nada de el, no llego a reunirse con su familia, lo unico que supo es que se cruzo el rio con unos venezolanos hacia EU, pero actualmente ya perdio todo contacto con el, desconoce si sigue vivo o no y con quien, Ella se encuentra desesperada por la persecucion de dicho cartel hasta esta ciudad.

Mexicana por solidaridad y ayuda humanitaria, le presta un espacio/cuarto dentro de su casa para salvaguardarse del peligro y las inclemencias del tiempo, por sus hijos pequeños.
